title: RBI Grade B - ESI - FLM 2 - Objective
instruction: The Ministry of Jal Shakti has recently (April 2023) released the report of India’s first water bodies census, a comprehensive data base of ponds, lakes, and reservoirs in the country. The census was conducted in 2018-19, and enumerated more than 2.4 million water bodies across all states and Union Territories. The objective of the Census of Water Bodies is to develop a national database for all water bodies by collecting information on all important aspects of the subject including their size, condition, status of encroachments, use, storage capacity, status of filling up of storage etc.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements are incorrect with respect to the above scheme? 1. Any adult member is eligible for benefits  under the scheme. 2. Members of EPF/ESIC are not eligible to apply under this scheme. 3. Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority is the pension fund manager in this scheme.
options: Only 1
2 and 3
1 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Choose the incorrect statement with respect to the above scheme.
options: Voluntary and contributory pension scheme on 50:50 basis
Matching contribution would be made by the Central Government
In case of death of subscriber, 75% of the pension is received by spouse in the form of family pension
If a subscriber died due to any cause (before age of 60 years), his/her spouse will have the option to exit the scheme OR join and continue the scheme
Aadhar card is mandatory for enrolment

quiz.text:
Which among the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above scheme?
1. Suhas who has monthly income of Rs. 14000 is eligible for benefits under the scheme.
2. Subscriber exits the scheme within a period of less than 10 years -  will receive his/her share of contribution along with accumulated interest as actually earned by fund or the savings bank interest rate whichever is higher.
3. Subscriber exits after a period of 10 years or more but before 60 years of age - will receive his/her share of contribution only along with savings bank interest rate.
4. The scheme is being implemented Ministry of Finance.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 4
(C) 1, 3 and 4
(D) 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: With respect to the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph, identify the incorrect statement of the scheme if any:
options: The scheme was launched in 2022
Scheme also focuses on bringing about a behaviour change amongst citizens towards sanitation workers and enhance demand for safe sanitation services
Nodal Ministry of the Scheme is Ministry of Jal Shakti in collaboration Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
National Safai Karamchari Financial Development Corporation (NSKFDC) is the implementing agency of the scheme
All are correct

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above scheme? 1. Objective is to have atleast 50% of sanitation work performed by skilled workers. 2. The beneficiaries and their family will be linked with the social security schemes. 3. Focus on the formal workforce for the capacity building will be done under this scheme.
options: Only 1
1 and 3
Only 2
2 and 3
Only 3

quiz.text: Under the scheme, the funding support in form of fixed rate of interest and subsidy for new ventures will be provided to the beneficiaries. With regards to this information, identify the incorrect statement(s) about livelihood assistance that will be provided to the beneficiaries under this scheme. 1. Rate of interest chargeable on self-employment projects including sanitation related projects upto 1 Lakh is 4% for women. 2. Upfront Capital subsidy for individuals from 5 Lakh to 15 Lakh is 50% of the project cost. 3. Interest subvention for the rate of interest charged by the Bank over and above the rates of interest prescribed under the scheme is not admissible.
options: 1 and 3
2 and 3
1 and 2
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct with respect to Liberalized remittance scheme (LRS)?
options: Liberalized remittance scheme (LRS) was introduced in India in 2013.
Remittances can be made only in US Dollars.
There are no restrictions on frequency of remittances under LRS.
Scheme is also available to corporates, partnership firms, HUF, Trusts, etc.
Under the scheme, individuals are allowed to remit up to USD 25,000 per financial year for eligible transactions.

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to Liberalized remittance scheme (LRS)? A. Investor who has remitted funds under LRS cannot retain and reinvest income earned from his investments made under Scheme. B. Permanent Account Number (PAN) mandatory for all transactions under LRS. C. Remittance for trading in foreign exchange abroad is prohibited.
options: Only A
Only C
A and B
A and C
B and C

quiz.text: Under Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS), some types of transactions are expressly prohibited, which among the following are under prohibited category?1. Remittance for any purpose specifically prohibited or any item restricted under Schedule II of Foreign Exchange Management (Current Account Transactions) Rules, 20002. Remittances for purchase of Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds (FCCBs) issued by Indian companies in the overseas primary market3. Capital account remittances, directly or indirectly, to countries identified by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) as non- cooperative countries and territories, from time to time4. Remittance for trading in foreign exchange abroad
options: (A) 1 and 3
(B) 1, 3 and 4
(C) Only 3
(D) 2, 3 and 4
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It focuses on developing capacities of health systems and institutions across the continuum of care only at primary level in both the urban and rural areas.

B. Earlier known as Prime Minister Atmanirbhar Swasth Bharat Yojana’ (PMASBY) Scheme.

C. It is Centrally Sponsored Scheme with some Central Sector Components.
options: B and C
A and C
A and B
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not one of the interventions under the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs) in Rural areas
District Integrated Public Health Units
Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs) in Urban areas
Integrated Public Health Labs
Critical Care Hospital Blocks

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. Educational / Training Institutions, SHG and agriculture are eligible for coverage under the scheme. B. The corpus of CGTMSE is being contributed by the GoI and SIDBI in the ratio of 1:1 respectively. C. Fund and non-fund based (Letters of Credit, Bank Guarantee etc.) credit facilities up to Rs 200 lakh per eligible borrower are covered under the guarantee scheme.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the guarantee coverage under the above scheme? A. The extent of guarantee cover is 75% for micro enterprises for credit up to Rs 5 lakh. B. The extent of guarantee cover is 75% of the sanctioned amount of the credit facility for credit above Rs 50 lakh per MSE borrower. C. The extent of guarantee cover is 85% for Micro and Small Enterprises operated and/or owned by women.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following statements are correct with respect to the Members of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) scheme? A. MPs are to recommend every year, works costing at least 15% of the MPLADS entitlement for the year for areas inhabited by SC and 7.5% for areas inhabited by ST population. B. The District Authority shall make the selection of an appropriate Implementing Agency through which a particular work recommended by an MP would be executed. C. An elected MP cannot recommend works anywhere in the country outside the usual region in which he/ she can recommend work.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to Scheme for Minor Rape Victims? 1. It aims to provide integrated support and assistance to girl child victims under one roof, facilitate immediate, emergency and non-emergency access to a range of services. 2. Total financial outlay of the scheme is ₹100 Crore. 3. Scheme would operate under aegis of Nirbhaya Fund.
options: Only 1
2 and 3
1 and 3
Only 3
All of the above

quiz.text:
Which the following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to Scheme for Expansion and Modernization of Fire Services in States?

A. Objective is to expand and modernize Fire Services within National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF).

B. It is being implemented by Ministry of Finance.

C. Scheme finds its origin from recommendation of Fifteenth Finance Commission (XV-FC).
options: Only A
Only B
B and C
Only C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the components under the PM-KUSUM (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthaan Mahabhiyan) Scheme? A. Component A - Solarization of 15 Lakh Grid-connected Solar Powered Agriculture Pumps. B. Component B - Addition of 10,000 MW of solar capacity through installation of small solar power plants of capacity up to 2 MW. C. Component C - Installation of 20 lakh standalone Solar Powered Agriculture Pumps.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following schemes were merged into PM AJAY? A. Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana B. Babu Jagjivan Ram Chhatrawas Yojana C. Special Central Assistance to Scheduled Castes Sub Plan
options: A and B only
B and C
C only
A, B and C
A and C only

quiz.text: Which one of the following statements is correct with respect to National Mission on Natural Farming?
options: Centre shall prepare a long-term perspective plan with year-wise targets and goals.
Area falling under the 10 km corridor on either side of river Ganga will be accorded highest priority.
Champion farmer shall be engaged on honorarium basis for a period of 5 years.
Target is to cover 7.5 lakh ha area by developing 15,000 clusters in next 4 years.
Only the Gram Panchayat/ villages having minimum of 5 practicing natural farmers be selected for roll out of natural farming cluster.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the sub-schemes of the National Beekeeping and Honey Mission? A. Under Mini Mission-I, focus is on post-harvest management of beekeeping/beehive products. B. Under Mini Mission-II, focus is on production & productivity improvement of various crops. C. Under Mini Mission-III, focus is on Research & Technology generation.
options: A and B
Only A
Only C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct with respect to scheme described in above passage?
options: Students can take admission only in empanelled Institutes within state.
Scheme is for studies in India and abroad.
Student should not be getting any other scholarship.
Scholarship given starting from class XI to graduation in India.
There is no ceiling even for students studying in private sector.

quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023), Global Survey on Digital and Sustainable Trade Facilitation was by United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia Paciﬁc's (UNESCAP). Consider the following statements regarding the findings.A. India has an impressive score of 93.55% in 2023B. India achieved a perfect score of 100% in five key indicatorsC. India scored 77.8% in 2023 for the “Women in Trade Facilitation” indicatorWhich of the above statement is correct?
options: Only A
Both A and C
Only C
Both A and B
All of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released Performance Grading Index for Districts (PGI-D), which state has topped in the ‘Ati Uttam’ (3rd out of 10 grades) category, with 18 districts in 2021-2022?
options: Himachal Pradesh
Kerala
Tamil Nadu
Punjab
Karnataka

quiz.text:
Recently (In June), the World Bank released Detox Development "Repurposing Environmentally Harmful Subsidies" report. Consider the following statements regarding the report.

A. Subsidies in the agriculture, fishing, and fossil fuel sectors exceeded $10 trillion.

B. Agricultural sector, explicit subsidies amounted to $635 billion.

C. The fisheries sector receives 35.4 billion per year in subsidies.

Which of the above statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both B and C
Both A and C

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to ‘Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation Act, 2013’?1.      One Time Cash Assistance of Rs. 10,000 is given under the act.2.      The Act bans the use of any individual for manually cleaning, carrying, disposing of or otherwise handling in any manner, human excreta till its disposal.3.      Municipalities are now responsible for identifying and rehabilitating manual scavengers.
options: 1 and 2
2 only
1 and 3
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (May 2023), the Tele-Law programe has achieved a new milestone with 40 Lakh beneficiaries across the country having been empowered with pre-litigation advice. Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to Tele-law?
options: It was launched in 2017.
It is an e-interface mechanism to seek legal advice and consultation at a pre-litigation stage.
Advice is free of Cost to those who are eligible for free legal aid under Section 12 of LSA (legal service authority) Act, 1987.
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the 4th National Water Awards, 2022 were conferred by the Vice President of India at New Delhi. Which of the following pairs is/are correctly matched with regards to the awards?1.      Best State                                                        -     Madhya Pradesh2.      Best Urban Local Body                                  -     Indore Municipal Corporation3.      Best District                                                     -     Adilabad, Telangana4.      Best industry for CSR                                     -     HCL Technologies Ltd., Noida, Uttar Pradesh
options: 1, 3 and 4
1, 2, 3 and 4
1 and 4
1 and 2
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Vice President of India launched an animated short film on ‘Piku’, the mascot of National Water Mission during the 4th National Water Awards, 2022 ceremony. Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to National Water Mission?1.      NWM has been launched under Swachh Bharat Mission.2.      Goal is to increase water use efficiency by 60%.3.      Goal is promotion of basin level integrated water resources management.
options: 1 and 3
2 only
3 only
1 and 2
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), which of the following ministries has set up Unnat Takniki Pradarshan Kendra (UTPRERAK), a Centre of Excellence?
options: Ministry of Education
Ministry of Power
Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Ministry of Science and Technology

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to the India’s 1st Water Bodies Census?
options: It is a comprehensive inventory of only natural water bodies.
Out of total water bodies 97.1 per cent are in rural areas and only 2.9 per cent are in urban areas.
West Bengal has highest number of ponds and reservoirs.
Tamil Nadu has highest number of lakes.
None of the above
